metadata.Title: CVE-2019-5063 on Ubuntu 20.04 ESM (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
An exploitable heap buffer overflow vulnerability exists in the data structure persistence functionality of OpenCV 4.1.0. A specially crafted XML file can cause a buffer overflow, resulting in multiple heap corruptions and potential code execution. An attacker can provide a specially crafted file to trigger this vulnerability.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-5063` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libopencv-calib3d4.2 - 4.2.0+dfsg-5
libopencv-contrib4.2 - 4.2.0+dfsg-5
libopencv-core4.2 - 4.2.0+dfsg-5
libopencv-dnn4.2 - 4.2.0+dfsg-5
libopencv-features2d4.2 - 4.2.0+dfsg-5
libopencv-flann4.2 - 4.2.0+dfsg-5
libopencv-highgui4.2 - 4.2.0+dfsg-5
libopencv-imgcodecs4.2 - 4.2.0+dfsg-5
libopencv-imgproc4.2 - 4.2.0+dfsg-5
libopencv-ml4.2 - 4.2.0+dfsg-5
libopencv-objdetect4.2 - 4.2.0+dfsg-5
libopencv-photo4.2 - 4.2.0+dfsg-5
libopencv-shape4.2 - 4.2.0+dfsg-5
libopencv-stitching4.2 - 4.2.0+dfsg-5
libopencv-superres4.2 - 4.2.0+dfsg-5
libopencv-video4.2 - 4.2.0+dfsg-5
libopencv-videoio4.2 - 4.2.0+dfsg-5
libopencv-videostab4.2 - 4.2.0+dfsg-5
libopencv-viz4.2 - 4.2.0+dfsg-5
libopencv4.2-java - 4.2.0+dfsg-5
libopencv4.2-jni - 4.2.0+dfsg-5
opencv-data - 4.2.0+dfsg-5
python3-opencv - 4.2.0+dfsg-5
No subscription required

notes.Note: ccdm94> in bionic and earlier, functions fixed by commit are in file modules/core/src/persistence.cpp instead of the ones presented in the upstream patch. However, upstream reports that versions 3.4.8 and older are not affected, due to code refactoring. See: https://github.com/opencv/ opencv/issues/15857.

criterions.comment: opencv package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.2.0+dfsg-5').
